bibl.title: In Re: Petition of Ham Hung Wah by Tom Sing for Writ of Habeas Corpus.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

div1.p: IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES,
IN THE MATTER OF Ham Hung Wah On Habeas Corpus
The President of the United States of America, To Thomas M. Fisher, Chinese Inspector in Charge, Fort Townsend, Greeting:

You are Hereby Commanded, That you have the body of Ham Hung Wah by you imprisoned and detained, as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention by whatsover name he shall be called or charged, before the Honorable the Circuit Court of the United States, for the Ninth Judicial Circuit, District of Washington, at the Court-room of said Court, in the City of on the 25th day of October 1904 at 9 o'clock 0 M., to do an receive what shall then me considered in the premiere, And have you then and there this Writ

Witness, the Honorable MELVILLE W. FULLER. Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States, and the seal of said Circuit Court, this 8th day of October is the year of our Lord one thousand eightnine hundred and ninetyfour, and of our Independence the 129th A. Reeves. Ayres Clerk By Deputy Clerk
In obedience to the within Writ, I hereby produce the body of>certify I served this writ on Thomas M. Fisher as within directed and return that, I hold in my custody, by virtue ofat October 11, 1904
C.B. Hopkins M.S. Marshal By John Stringer Deputy
Circuit Court of the United States, NINTH JUDICIAL CIRCUIT, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, Northern Division.
IN THE MATTER OF Ham Hung Wah ON HABEAS CORPUS.
WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AND RETURN THERETO.
Filed on return, this 10th day of October 1904 189 A. Reeves. Ayres Clerk. By Deputy Clerk.
